problem_text:
19.90. A skew brace is a set B equipped with two operations + and · such that (B, +)
is an additively written (but not necessarily abelian) group, (B, ·) is a multiplicatively
written group, and a · (b + c) = ab − a + ac for any a, b, c ∈ B.
b) Is there a skew brace with non-soluble additive group but nilpotent multiplica-
tive group?
c) Is there a finite skew brace with soluble additive group but non-soluble multi-
plicative group?
A. Smoktunowicz, L. Vendramin
